newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Lernout & Hauspie says buys Berkeley Speech Tech.
newsitem.headline: Lernout & Hauspie says buys Berkeley Speech Tech.

text.p: Belgian voice-to-text firm Lernout & Hauspie Speech Products said on Tuesday it had bought U.S. text-to-speech company Berkeley Speech Technologies for $15.5 million in cash
L&H said Berkeley's revenue in the year to September was $5 million, with an operating profit of some 40 percent.
The firm added that the purchase, which would create the conditions for it to become one of the key players in the text-to-speech market, would help lift earnings per share.

"The combination of BST's successful and dedicated consumer market approach for text-to-speech with one of the market leaders in speech technologies, Lernout & Hauspie, should result in a formidable, competitive player in the speech-to-text market, Berkeley Chairwoman and co-founder Elisabeth Peters said in a statement issued by L&H.
